Text: [Jaskier]  ♪ I'm weak, love, and I am wanting ♪

Which one do you prefer? Lovely"? "Gorgeous"?"
Is the whole metaphor landing, or is it too cerebral?
Let's get on before the beast gets hungry again.
We made a deal with a livin' witcher.
No sense in hangin' around to pay a dead one.
Bollocks! Oi! No. No, no, no! No!
Aah! You stop-- stop that, or I-- I'll, uh...
Perhaps you did not hear the man.
Do as the bard asks or I'll be forced to draw my weapons.
This woman just killed a man with her bare hands
for trying to steal your horse.
Maybe she'll make a better travel companion, then.
Uh, I'm sorry, who are you, exactly?
These are my companions, Téa and Véa.
I've been looking for you, Geralt of Rivia.
This is a first for me, and that's saying something.
But to dine with the Geralt of Rivia...
I suppose you want me to tell you why I've sought out
Don't trouble yourself on my account.
One of everything you have. And keep the ale coming!
a green dragon landed across the border in King Niedamir's mountains.
Locals spotted it and went after it in search of treasure.
Of course, they succeeded only in wounding the creature
that it swooped down from its lair and set half a hillside ablaze.
You have the most incredible neck.
It's like a... a sexy goose.
[Borch] Now, the King is in a bind.
He's set to marry the princess of his rival kingdom, Malleore,
to have a murderous pest lurking about in the mountains.
He's commissioned a hunt to kill it.
The winner gets the dragon treasure hoard
plus the title of lord over one of his new vassal states.
What does this have to do with me?
I want you to join my team.
Oh! [chuckles] We're so doing this. We're in.
No treasure is worth dying for.
One final first before I'm too old to do anything but die.
You think killing a dragon will bring you that?
All I know is there's one path up the mountain,
With you on my team, dear Witcher, we'll be unstoppable.
[man] Someone get me a fuckin' drink!
Those dwarfs will be part of the hunt.
Geralt could handle them in his sleep.
He said he wants four fuckin' pints!
Or maybe a little bit awake.
Have you heard of them, Witcher?
You feel it just the same as me...
That itch that can't be scratched that burns your brain,
I'll show you what you're missing.
Sorry to interrupt this lovely moment... That's only three.
Where's the-- What's the fourth team?
Oh, no, no, no, no, no.  Thank you so much. It's been very nice.
Thank you for the wine and the pies,
but as the man said, we really can't get involved.
Your man might've mentioned that the road was too narrow for horses
three days' journey and only one route to the top.
Leaves plenty of time for me to piss in his gruel! [cackles]
And my name is Julian Alfred Pankratz--
You'll fetch a goodly amount for that mare if you sell now!
Charming how everyone wants to get their hands on Roach these days, isn't it?
He means we won't make it out alive.
Wait, what? No one mentioned anything about impending death!
How is it that I've walked this earth for decades
and then the first one I meet, I can't get rid of?
[Jaskier] I'd say something strange was afoot,
but then again, witchers are bound to bump into monsters eventually.
What are you doing here, Yen?
To assist him in killing the dragon.
Did my grandmother know him well?
Why did she never mention him to me before... that night?
Protecting you has always been our primary purpose.
Why'd she let him claim the Law of Surprise?
When one has saved another from certain death,
the Law of Surprise can be claimed
Duny. In payment, he bound you to Geralt.
Then why hasn't he found me yet?
[Jaskier] It is so kind of you to share the spoils of this expedition
with an old man such as Borch.
To hunt with him is an honor unsullied by payment.
You worry if you blink, you'll never see her again.
the danger here isn't the dragon.
[Borch] That's why I brought you along, Geralt of Rivia.
Then you don't know Yennefer of Vengerberg.
May she be the worst encounter, then.
It should have left when they attacked.
I don't get it. Why the retaliation?
When your species is on the verge of collapse,
[Jaskier] Yeah, I mean, you can use twigs,
uh, but I-- I mean, I personally prefer...
A cactus, if she's really into it.
Allow me to wander aimlessly into this thicket
I am hungry. Anyone else hungry?
It sort of looks like a faun.
Aw! Aren't you just the cutest...
terrifying thing I've ever seen in my entire life.
Right, run away! Run away! Geralt!
It's one of your... friends again.
What in the name of Bloemenmagde is that?
It's probably starving. Sheathe your weapons.
If we'd fed it, it would've gone away.
That knight may be a fuckin' dumbbell,
but I'll be damned, the dragon won't stand a chance.
[Borch] Um...  I'm not sure I'd eat that, good sir.
It's precisely why I'll make a great lord to Niedamir's vassal state.
A great knight must lead by example.
My subjects will be the luckiest serfs in all the lands.
Especially with the beautiful Yennefer as my mage.
I cannot wait to serve you, My Lord.
How would you like to serve me tonight...
So, the Witcher wants to play knight too, hmm?
She's plenty able of murdering you herself.
What's so amusin', you overgrown cock hair?
I'm just wondering who I will kill first.
Um... I'm afraid I must take my leave.
Lady Yennefer, may I escort you to your tent?
...never degrade your honor in such a way.
[snorts] I hate to break it to you, but that ship has sailed,
wrecked and sunk to the bottom of the ocean.
[Yarpen] So, shall we tell the poor bastard
that he's vying for a vassal state that won't exist in a decade?
States rise and fall like the tide.
The rightful son of Nilfgaard has returned, burnin' through the south.
I saw it with my own eyes down in Ebbing.
Those zealot freaks are inching closer by the day.
Won't be long till they try and take Sodden.
Queen Calanthe would die before letting them take what's hers.
Perhaps if Nilfgaard's religious zeal had been tempered earlier
I must get my beauty sleep.
I don't think it'll make me prettier,
So... we're all about to have new evil overlords,
and dragons are, in fact, a thing.
Oh, you've all seen a dragon before, have you?
Geralt, will you please tell them?
Treasure seekers saw to that. But they do exist.
like the one we have here,
For a gold dragon to exist,
it would... have to be the result of...
gold dragons met the same fate as anything too different to endure.
There are other ways of enduring.
perhaps you should take the overgrown cock hair's advice and become a knight.
You'd make a rather shitty one, refusing to slay dragons.
But probably not as shitty a one as Sir Eyck of Denesle!
[Mousesack] Keep walking. The Nilfgaardians could be anywhere.
[Dara] How did you escape the attack, Mousesack?
[Dara] Ciri says you vanished into thin air.
Why did you abandon your Princess?
I was pulled through a portal by Nilfgaard,
kidnapped and held prisoner for days.
And how did you escape them?
He sent me to get Ciri.
Trained to fight and bound to Ciri.
And he rescued you so you could then rescue her?
just past this thicket of trees.
Do you know what happens to people who escape a siege?
They get captured and they get turned.
Remember what the Dryad Queen said.
It's not just your life, Ciri.  It's mine too.
Who slits a man's throat while he's relieving his bowels?
[Véa] We're halfway to the dragon's lair, but it's getting dangerous.
and it wasn't any of us.
Our people used to mine these mountains.
We know a shortcut that will cut half a day off our journey.
Let the Reavers take the long way around.
We'll nab the treasure before they even set foot in the cave.
We'll watch each other's backs until we reach the next peak,
And you're the one who's been  staring daggers at him since we arrived.
That bastard Boholt killed my escort
before he could accomplish the one damn task I actually needed him for.
What are you really doing here?
There are certain healing properties it's rumored to possess.
At the cost of losing others, yes.
do not tell me you've traveled all this way
for made-up fertility cures using fresh dragon hearts?
Do you think I'd make a bad one?
A child? What could you possibly want with a child?
They took my choice. I want it back.
Not that I'd expect you to understand.
I didn't choose to become a witcher.
they made us sterile for a lot of reasons.
is because this lifestyle isn't suited to a child.
You were going to summon chaos on kings' orders
And I'd rather use my Child Surprise as bruxa bait
than subject it to this life!
You lecture me on made-up cures for having a child,
meanwhile you cheat with destiny to steal one.
I say more in five minutes than I've said in weeks.
they're leading us to a shorter path.
I can take care of myself.
Did you ever stop missing Skellige?
It's just that I don't think I'll ever stop missing Cintra, but...
you left your home to come raise me, how did you feel about that?
Ice skating with Crach an Craite?
He always said he let me win, but I was just faster.
Did you miss the cold too?
And you always said Skellige was where you came from
but Cintra was your home, with us!
We prefer it like this anyway.
Where are you taking us? Who wants her?
The man with the winged helmet.
Why is he going to so much trouble?
I'm special. I don't know how or why, but there's something inside me.
Wait, no, no, no, no, no!
[Yarpen] Mind the scree fallin', hear me?
Can get a bit rocky round here if it's windy.
Yeah, you're right, this is a shortcut... to death.
You wanna beat those Reavers or not?
How can you possibly know that?
As long as you don't look down.
[Yarpen] See ya on the other side!
Come on, Jask. You've got this.
Oh, that is not a good sign.
That is not a good sign.
Sir Witcher, you will save us yet.
But first, you must let go.
There's nothing else you could have done.
Look, why don't we leave tomorrow?
That is, if you'll give me another chance to prove myself a...
We could head to the coast.
Sounds like something Borch would say, doesn't it?
Just trying to work out what pleases me.
Is this not what you came for?
I was afraid that mountain would take you from me,
but now I fear it took your senses instead.
The moment I dread most every time you leave...
I woke up in that destroyed house and you were gone.
They say witchers can't feel human emotion.
They say whatever justifies despising our kind.
It's hard to regret something you didn't choose.
But if the choice had been yours,
what would you have done instead?
But if I ever dreamed of being something...
it was too long ago to remember.
Did you dream of being a mage?
I didn't have much of a choice either.
Did you always want to become a mother?
At a quick pace, we can make it back to the Pensive Dragon before sundown.
What are you talking about? We're almost at the top.
I came here for a reason, Geralt.
I'm not leaving till I've killed that dragon.
If there had been any other way to extract you, I'd have done it.
It was never my intention to torment you, Princess.
all I've ever wanted is to help you fulfill your destiny.
The White Flame has brought us together.
You are the key to everything, Cirilla.
I'll get you something to eat.
You didn't tell us what she is.
Do you really believe all this nonsense in your head?
her cry was heard by Villentretenmerth.
But the egg could not be moved
or the life inside it would die.
[Téa] And then we heard about the King's hunt,
realized we had to keep our enemies close.
So I came to find you,
the knight who was taught to save dragons instead of kill them.
Looks like we get to fuck up the whole family.
So I get to kill you after all, Witcher.
Shame you don't get to see me crack that egg!
What the fuck are you doing here?
Well, that's fuckin' shite! We missed a whole mother lode of fun.
Ask no questions, and in return, I offer you these to take to the King.
I've never been one to look a gift cock in the beak,
though this might not be enough proof to collect the reward.
Tell the King if he's not satisfied,
he can expect the body of a dragon dropped upon his royal wedding.
He caught me. He's going to come back,  Dara. We have to hurry.
If we had just stayed in Brokilon, Ciri, we'd be safe right now!
Because we agreed to it. Hmm?
If I stay with you any longer, I'll be dead too.
And you say you're so special.
What you really mean is that you're just like Calanthe!
You bring terror and you bring death wherever you are!
I'm doing the best that I can.
I'm done apologizing. I'm done with all of this.
because I can't be there for you anymore.
There is no other reason to go on.
And thank you, Yennefer of Vengerberg.
I can see why Geralt didn't want to lose you.
That's why we can't escape each other.
Why I feel this way inside.
[Yennefer] It's not because of anything real...
Disregard for other's freedom has become quite your trademark.
I made that wish to save your life.
And you, you flit about like a tornado,
So you can have a baby?
A child is no way to boost your fragile ego, Yen.
I'll take advice from you about children as soon as you take responsibility
for the one you bound to you and then abandoned!
I'm going to save you both a lot of hurt with a little pain now.
The sorceress will never regain her womb.
And though you didn't want to lose her, Geralt,
You wanted to show me what I was missing...
What you're missing is still out there.
Why is it whenever I find myself  in a pile of shit these days,
If life could give me one blessing,
it would be to take you off my hands.
I'll go get the rest of the story from the others.
A simple test of silver would've sufficed.
I had steel at the ready.
We can pull in more soldiers. Keep searching.
We cannot mistake the stars reflecting  in a pond for those in the night sky.
You rose up against the Usurper.
Helped free our people from their chains.
I witnessed the White Flame call on you...
And we will spread his supremacy all through the kingdoms,
The time of the sword and the ax is nigh.
